quotes.quote: The death of dogma is the birth of morality.
...when dogma enters the brain, all intellectual activity ceases.
The dogmas of the quiet past are inadequate to the stormy present.
Dogma does not mean the absence of thought, but the end of thought.
Dogma, whatever form it takes, is the ultimate enemy of human freedom.
In the world of dogma, you become free the day you decide to go to hell.
Religious dogma creates a perfect fertilizer for the weeds of hypocrisy.
Dogma not only blinds its protagonist, but it muzzles all other opposition.
The power of religious dogma, when inculcated early, is such as to stifle conscience, compassion, and finally every feeling of humanity.
Old religious dogma attempts to convince you that you are on a journey to God, then makes you pay tolls along that roadway.
Dogma gives a charter to mistake, but the very breath of science is a contest with mistake, and must keep the conscience alive.
To 'choose' dogma and faith over doubt and experience is to throw out the ripening vintage and to reach greedily for the Kool-Aid.
Dogma in power does have a unique chilling ingredient not exhibited by power, however ghastly, wielded for its own traditional sake.
Dogmas are the toys that amuse and can satisfy but unreasoning children. They are the offspring of human speculation and prejudiced fancy.
Dogmas of every kind put assertion in the place of reason and give rise to more contention, bitterness, and want of charity than any other influence in human affairs.
Now any dogma, based primarily on faith and emotionalism, is a dangerous weapon to use on others, since it is almost impossible to guarantee that the weapon will never be turned on the user.

Dogmas are collective conceptual prisons. And the strange thing is that people love their prison cells because they give them a sense of security and a false sense of 'I know.' Nothing has inflicted more suffering on humanity than its dogmas.

Dogma demands authority, rather than intelligent thought, as the source of opinion; it requires persecution of heretics and hostility to unbelievers; it asks of its disciples that they should inhibit natural kindliness in favor of systematic hatred.
Philosophical dogma doesn't interest me.
The modern dogma is comfort at any cost.
Dogma can in no way limit a limitless God.
The dogma is that, that dogma is a mistake.
Every dogma embodies some shade of truth to give it seeming currency.
Don't let the Dogma of men to interfere with your Destiny.
There is no dogma that the organ or harmonium can be used in church, but not the drum.
It's only a dogma that hells exists; it isn't a dogma that there's anybody in it.
Dogma is the convictions of one man imposed authoritatively upon others.
Dogma is invariably wrong, as knowledge is always in a state of transition.
Religious dogma is akin to an appetizer with no garnish.
You don't have to believe anything, adopt a dogma in order to learn how to meditate.
I tend to believe that religious dogma is a consequence of evolution.
Dogma is the guardian of mystery. The doctrines are spiritually significant in ways that we cannot fathom.
Dogma is a defensive reaction against doubt in the mind of the theorist, but doubt of which he is unaware.
The dogma of the infallibility of the Bible is no more self-evident than is that of the infallibility of the popes.
Dogma, static positions, consonance - all these are obstacles to catching the disease of art, at least in its more complex forms.
The dogma of woman's complete historical subjection to men must be rated as one of the most fantastic myths ever created by the human mind.
Every dogma, every philosophic or theological creed, was at its inception a statement in terms of the intellect of a certain inner experience.
Dogma and shrinking from the external world are at one limit of the range of belief. At the other are science and poetry and, indeed, reality.
Dogma is a lie reiterated and authoritatively injected into the mind of one or more persons who believe that they believe what someone else believes.
Dogma in science really is humiliating when it is recognized as dogma.
Dogma is no substitute for an inner religious experience.

The dogma of the Incarnation is the most dramatic thing about Christianity, and indeed, the most dramatic thing that ever entered the mind of man; but if you tell people so, they stare at you in bewilderment.
Every dogma has its day.
Please clean up after your dogma.
You can't teach an old dogma new tricks.
